thread.title: Couple arrested for 'abduction attempt on premature baby at Great Ormond Street Hospital'
thread.title_full: Couple arrested for 'abduction attempt on premature baby at Great Ormond Street Hospital'

author: Stian Alexander
title: Couple arrested for 'abduction attempt on premature baby at Great Ormond Street Hospital'
text:
News Couple arrested for 'abduction attempt on premature baby at Great Ormond Street Hospital' A 31-year-old man and a 26-year-old woman allegedly turned up at the hospital in Camden, north London, on Monday afternoon Share Great Ormond Street Hospital in Camden, north London, where the incident allegedly occurred (Photo: Getty Images) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A couple has been arrested on suspicion of trying to abduct a premature baby at Great Ormond Street Hospital . 
A 31-year-old man and a 26-year-old woman were arrested at the hospital in Camden, north London, on Monday afternoon. 
Officers arrived at the scene and arrested the couple on suspicion of conspiracy to abduct a child. 
Inspector Paul Clarke, of the Met Police, said: “The actions of the staff at Great Ormond Street Hospital in making all of the necessary checks and the quick response of police in arresting a couple prevented what could have been a very frightening and harrowing incident.” The Great Ormond Street Hospital is world famous for its work (Photo: Getty) 
A spokeswoman for Great Ormond Street Hospital said: “Thankfully, this type of incident is exceptionally rare. We are pleased that staff at the hospital acted so swiftly and calmly to ensure the safety of all our patients.” 
The couple have now been released on bail on the condition that they should not enter any hospital - unless they are suffering a "medical emergency". Like us on Facebook
